meanings.sent1: She made several goofs on her math test.
meanings.sent2: The teacher pointed out the goofs in the student's essay.
meanings.sent3: His goofs in the kitchen always lead to burnt food.
meanings.sent4: The goofs in the plan caused the project to fail.
meanings.sent5: The goofs in his speech were embarrassing for him.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: He often goofs when typing on the computer.
meanings.sent2: She goofs up the recipe every time she tries to bake.
meanings.sent3: The comedian purposely goofs during his stand-up routine for laughs.
meanings.sent4: If you rush, you're more likely to goof and make mistakes.
meanings.sent5: Don't goof on the important details of the project.

meanings.sent1: Their goofs at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The children's goofs often lead to funny situations.
meanings.sent3: His goofs in class always brighten up the atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The goofs in the comedy show had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent5: She couldn't help but giggle at his silly goofs.
